benchmark_details.name: ArabicaQA
benchmark_details.overview: ArabicaQA is the first large-scale dataset for machine reading comprehension and open-domain question answering in Arabic, consisting of 89,095 answerable and 3,701 unanswerable questions created to address the lack of Arabic NLP resources.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive dataset for enhancing Arabic natural language processing, particularly in machine reading comprehension and open-domain question answering.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Focused on Modern Standard Arabic and sourced solely from Wikipedia, limiting linguistic diversity.

data.annotation: Questions generated by crowdworkers and reviewed for quality by language experts.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the performance of various models on the dataset.
methodology.interpretation: High scores in metrics indicate strong model performance on the Arabic question answering tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: AraBERT showed the highest performance across all metrics for Arabic.
methodology.validation: Human evaluation for the quality of question-answer pairs was performed by Arabic linguistics experts.
